text:
Hi
Is there an action in workflows what can help me check if a number in the phone property is exactly 8 digits and not starting with "+" or "00"?

Background info:
- The workflow will help format all phone numbers in the same way.
- In Denmark all phone numbers are 8 digits (not counting country code)
- The country code is +45
--- Sometimes the country code is written as 0045
- Most of our customers are danish, but we do have customers from other countries as well, so my workflow solution must accommodate that also.

The solution I have in mind
• Branch check if a phone number is starting with + or 00 :white_check_mark: 
• Branch check if a phone number is 8 digits. :point_left: How do I do that?  
• Transform the phone number depending on the above results. :white_check_mark: 
Any feedback on approach and how to solve the middle step is much appreciated.

Kind regards,
Thorlak

:wave: Hi Ryan, if you have thoughts or feedback for us surrounding the unenrollment feature (or any future versions of the feature) drop me a line. I’m the technical lead of the team that supports the feature and would love to hear your thoughts
If you don't want to involve custom code, your 'in mind' solution is likely the best way to manage it.
If you want to format the numbers with custom code, you've a pretty good example available: <https://www.HubSpot.com/programmable-automation-use-cases?offer=format-international-phone-numbers>
